bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to M.B. Crowell, November 20, 1921

div1.p: [Carter] requests changes and additions to the manuscript that he sent to Thomas Nelson and Sons publishing house.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to M.B. Crowell, November 20, 1921
div1.opener:
File Y. F
Abstract (Nogucha)
Nelson Loose- Leaf Medicine
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Nov. 20, 1921.
Dr. M. B. Crowell, Office Editor,
Thomas Nelson and Sons,
381 Fourth Avenue, New York, N. Y.
Dear Doctor Crowell:
div1.p:
Will you be pleased to make the following changes (additions)
to the MSS I forwarded you, November 9/1921, Abstract of the “Pro-
phylacis and Serum Therapy of Yellow Fever,” Hideyo Noguchi.

1) Page 5: Line 12: insert the word “latter” between the word
“this” and the word “place” so that this will read: “measures of con-
trol of the fever were adopted at this latter place or no.”

2) Page 5: Line 21: Add in continuation of this line, which at
present is the last one of the Paragraph: “The large number of
cases, 17, developing among the vaccinated group within 6 days after
vaccination evidences, however, that a part of this group at least
was fully exposed to infection up to the time of vaccination.” The
word “vaccination” will now end this paragraph.
3) Page 5: Add after the end of this Page the following paragraph:

"Noguchi states in a personal communication received since the
above was written that no particular section of Tuxpan was set a-
part for vaccination: that “those persons living in the neighbor-
hood of ywllow fever foci and who were most liable to be exposed to
infection were taken, or those who being non-immune applied for
vaccination because of fear of exposure.” This statement enormously
strengthens the evidence borne by the data from Tuxpan to the protect-
2
protect-
ive value of vaccination.

4) Page 8: Line 7: Add in continuation of this line---which
at present is the end of the paragraph, and of the article: “From
such places fever can be immediately eliminated by an effective
vaccination. For large places this is less applicable.”
